page.title: 01East and West Fortune,
page.content: East Lothian District The area to the west and north of East Fortune is rich agriculturla land, supporting crops of barley, rape and some root crops. There is also a sizeable garden centre at Congalton Gardens. The landscape is gently undulating almost monotonous with the wide expanse of ploughed fields bounded largely by hedges. The main village is East Fortune, although the village consist mainly of a military hospital, now used by the NHS and gradually running down. Plans for its closure are being discussed. South of East Fortune lies the military airfield, still used to some extent, but perhaps best known locally for the Sunday market held there each week. The Museum of Flight is also situated on the airfield, open to the public.
